Description: Eight fragments of a fine burnished black top brown pottery vessel of very fine Nile silt, with very thin walls. Remnant of the curved transition of the wall to the base remains, but no rim. The blackened interior has been burnished to a high lustre.
Dimensions: Length: 4.10 centimetres (max;fragment marked with identification numbers)
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 9)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
